@RachSalv What exactly do the @EnvAgency do? They do not adequately protect our environment from the many current catastrophic crisis it is facing from greedy polluters? We are seeing far too many failures by them.

Have you noticed the lovely weather recently? This time of year it's normal for some of our rivers to be low. However if you spot anything out of place, please report it to our hotline on 0800 80 70 60. https://t.co/LHSNcGyvBu

Installation of a pipe to slow the flow of water through Carr Dyke #Retford in times of adverse weather. This is a temporary solution, more permanent solutions are currently being discussed with @BassetlawDC @EnvAgency to alleviate #flooding in the area. https://t.co/YrtrcaAZOw

tweets.text:
Our experts are at the scene of a collision near Chatton, Northumberland, where a farm tanker overturned and spilled liquid fertiliser into the Mill Burn, a tributary of the River Till. 

We‚Äôre working with our partners to reduce the impact on the environment and wildlife. https://t.co/acL4lpvDRx

Great to see @Go_CheshireWest Council Leader Louise Gittins visit our Sustainable Urban Drainage project at @cheshire_hub on Friday. The @EnvAgency funded Rainzone project is delivered by @MyNorthwich team tackling localised flooding whilst creating space to grow fresh produce. https://t.co/5OStCxb582

Another great example of partnership working and delivering environmental outcomes and social outcomes at the same time. The @EnvAgencyNW project is tackling localised flooding in priority locations whilst also creating spaces for a food charity to grow and distribute fresh food https://t.co/4M9t8QY6hB

tweets.text: Have you ever wondered why rivers don‚Äôt run dry during the summer when rainfall is low? Groundwater in our #aquifers provides baseflow to surface water throughout the year and supports many important ecological wetlands. https://t.co/IgsNnqN74I

We manage the use of #groundwater resources sustainably to ensure that these important features are not at risk from the impact of human activities and climate change @GeoscienceEA.  https://t.co/TGDgTAMxNs #WaterSavingWeek

@Gwynthegriff @ChrisGPackham @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest @WiseBirding So why aren't you writing or tweeting to all those 'random reporters'? Or are you like that other HS2 fan who claimed to be a Guardian reporter, when it transpired all he had ever done was write a letter to the editor?
@Vincent9Helen @RachSalv @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe @SurreyWaste @NotoLandfillMK @Mullaghglass123 Well I suppose they help Red out a lot , but other than that nothing at all constructive .

*SIGH* The Environment Agency is being accused of not properly monitoring the bathing waters of the newly designated river Wharfe in Ilkley because it is only testing water upstream of a sewage works, when many bathers swim downstream of the plant. https://t.co/pt707mUPgq

We‚Äôre aware of sea trout caught and retained from the marine environment. It's an offence to retain salmon or sea trout unless you've a valid EA rod licence for migratory fish- buy online, by phone or at Post Office. Report illegal activity on 0800 807060 https://t.co/G7CmKGvOwr

tweets.text: More agricultural muck stored against the rules, literally on top of a watercourse this time. Lazy . Biased towards the side of harmful industries that put profit over people . Gaslighting . To name but a few . Chronic failures . @EnvAgency https://t.co/AIdGE5shXu
